question: Question_02_(d)
statement:
Consider the matrix

$A =\begin{bmatrix}
1& 2& 0& 3& 4 \\ 
2& 4& 3& 0& 5 \\ 
1& 2& -1& 5& 5 
\end{bmatrix}$

\textbf{(d)} Find a basis for the row space of \emph{A}.
sols:
From
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/December_2006/Question_02_(a)}{part
(a)}, we found that

\[\text{rref}(A)=
\begin{bmatrix} 
1& 2& 0& 3& 4\\ 
0& 0& 1& -2& -1 \\ 
0& 0& 0& 0& 0
\end{bmatrix}\]

We know that the basis of $R(A^T)$ i.e columns of $A^T$ corresponding to
the pivot columns of $rref(A^T)$, is the same as the pivot rows of
$rref(A)$. The pivot rows of $rref(A)$ are row 1 and 2.

Therefore a basis of \emph{R(A\textsuperscript{T})} is given by

\[\left\{
\begin{bmatrix}
1\\ 
2\\ 
0\\
3\\
4
\end{bmatrix}, \begin{bmatrix}
0\\ 
0\\ 
1\\
-2\\
1
\end{bmatrix}\right\}\]
